How do I change my password?
Use POST /api/nsk/v3/account/password/change to change an expired password for anonymous users. The session remains anonymous after the change.

POST /api/nsk/v3/account/password/change - changes an expired password for anonymous users only.

What does POST /api/nsk/v3/account/password/change do?
It changes an account password for users with expired passwords. This endpoint is restricted to anonymous users only and the user remains anonymous even after successful password change.

Is the user logged in after changing password?
No. The session remains anonymous after changing the password. This endpoint is restricted to anonymous users only.

Do I need authentication to call the password change API?
This endpoint is for anonymous users only. You need to provide valid credentials in the request body to authenticate, but the session remains anonymous.

Who can use this password change endpoint?
Anonymous users with expired passwords. This endpoint is restricted to anonymous users only and is recommended for users with expired passwords.

When should I use this endpoint vs /api/nsk/v3/user/password/change?
Use /api/nsk/v3/account/password/change for anonymous users with expired passwords. Use /api/nsk/v3/user/password/change for logged-in users changing their passwords.

List required fields for the password change request.
Required fields: credentials.password, credentials.domain, credentials.location, credentials.loginRole, newPassword. Either credentials.username OR credentials.alternateIdentifier is also required.

alternateIdentifier is optional, but either username OR alternateIdentifier must be provided in the credentials.

What error code is returned when password policy fails?
Error code "nsk:PasswordChange:Failed" with rawMessage containing "nsk-server:PasswordPolicy" indicates password policy violations.

How do I know if minimum password time is enforced?
You'll receive error code "nsk:PasswordChange:Failed" with rawMessage "nsk-server:PasswordMinimumTime" indicating the agent cannot change their password before the minimum time is up.

Does this endpoint support changing password for a logged-in user?
No. This endpoint is restricted to anonymous users only. Use /api/nsk/v3/user/password/change for logged-in users.

Can I reuse an old password?
Password history restrictions may apply based on domain configuration. You may receive error code "nsk-server:PasswordHistory" if attempting to reuse a recent password.

What's the difference between /api/nsk/v3/account/password/change and /api/nsk/v3/user/password/change?

/api/nsk/v3/account/password/change: For anonymous users with expired passwords; session stays anonymous.
/api/nsk/v3/user/password/change: For logged-in users updating their own password.

What does error code nsk:PasswordHistory mean?
Error code "nsk-server:PasswordHistory" indicates that the new password was previously used and cannot be reused due to password history restrictions.

Is alternateIdentifier supported and how is it used?

Yes, alternateIdentifier is optional. You can provide an alternative identifier (like customer number) in credentials.alternateIdentifier instead of username. Either username OR alternateIdentifier must be provided.

What error occurs when account is locked?
Error response with code "nsk:PasswordChange:Failed" and rawMessage "nsk-server:AgentLocked: The agent (WWW/ABC123) is locked."

What domain-level restrictions apply to password changes?

Domain restrictions include: minimum time requirements between password changes, password length requirements, character requirements, and password history restrictions. Violations result in failed password changes with specific error codes.

Can I use this endpoint for regular password updates?
This endpoint is recommended for users with expired passwords and restricted to anonymous users only. For regular password updates by logged-in users, use /api/nsk/v3/user/password/change instead.
